contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|whistler}} {{tocright}} '''Whistler''' may refer to: * Someone who [[whistling|whistles]] * [[Whistler Group]], a brand name of mobile electronic equipment * [[Whistler (radio)]], a very low frequency radio phenomenon * ''[[The Whistler]]'', a classic mystery drama radio show and [[film noir]] series * ''[[The Whistler (1944)|The Whistler]]'' (1944), the first of eight films in "The Whistler" series * [[Whistler (TV series)|''Whistler'' (TV series)]], a TV series set in Whistler, British Columbia * a [[Whistler (bird)]], a group of passerine birds in the family Pachycephalidae * [[Goldeneye (bird)]], a Northern Hemisphere seaduck in the genus Bucephala * [[Hoary marmot]], an American species of marmot * the development codename for the Microsoft [[Windows XP]] computer operating system, named for the resort where it was workshopped (see below) * ''The Whistler'', a 1977 single by the British rock group [[Jethro Tull (band)|Jethro Tull]] * [[Whistler (band)]], a UK indie band * ''The Whistler'', [[Fourplay]]'s instrumental song in its 2008 album ''[[Energy (jazz album)|Energy]]'' * {{USS|Whistler|SP-784}}, a United States Navy patrol vessel in commission from 1917 to 1919 == Canada == * [[Whistler, British Columbia]], a "resort municipality" in British Columbia, Canada ** [[The Whistler Sliding Centre|Whistler Sliding Centre]], a Canadian [[bobsleigh]], [[luge]], and [[skeleton (sport)|skeleton]] track located in Whistler, British Columbia, Canada * [[Whistler Blackcomb]], a ski resort in British Columbia, Canada * [[Whistler Mountain]], the geographic entity, named for the hoary marmot, that is one of the two mountains the above ski resort is based around; also a glacier and a creek on that same mountain * [[Whistler railway station]], a railway station on the Canadian National Railway in Whistler, British Columbia * [[Whistler Olympic Park]], The cross country skiing facility in the Callaghan Valley near Whistler in B.C., which hosted the cross country skiing, biathlon, Nordic combined, and ski jumping events in the Vancouver 2010 Olympics == United States == * [[Whistler, Alabama]], Alabama, was an unincorporated town in Mobile County, until the 1950s when it was annexed into neighboring Prichard == People == * [[Whistler (surname)]], living and deceased members of Whistler family of England * [[James McNeill Whistler]] (1834–1903), American-British artist best known for the painting [[Whistler's Mother]], portraying his mother [[Anna McNeill Whistler]] (1804–1881) * [[Charles Whistler]] (1856–1913), British writer * [[George Washington Whistler]] (1800–1849), American railroad engineer * [[James Abbott McNeill Whistler]] (1834–1903), American-born British painter * [[Rex Whistler]] (1905–1944), British painter * [[Laurence Whistler]] (1912–2000), British glass engraver and poet == Fictional characters == * Erwin 'Whistler' Emory, a character in the film [[Sneakers (1992 film)|Sneakers]] * [[Whistler (Buffyverse)]], a character in the television series ''Buffy the Vampire Slayer'' * [[Abraham Whistler]], mentor to the Marvel Comics character Blade in film and animated continuity * [[James Whistler (Prison Break character)]], mysterious inmate in the television series Prison Break's third season {{disambiguation|surname|geo}}
